required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Green Tea and Ultraviolet Light-induced Skin Damage
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Topically Applied Constituents of Green Tea on UV Induced Increase in p53 and Apoptotic Markers in the Skin of Human Volunteers

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether topically applied constituents of green tea [caffeine or (-)-epigallocatechin gallate; EGCG] have a protective effect on skin exposed to ultraviolet light (UV).

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate if topically applied constituents of green tea [caffeine or (-) - epigallocatechin gallate; EGCG] have a protective effect on skin exposed to ultraviolet light (UV). In the double-blinded study all subjects will receive 311 nanometer UVB light at a dose that is 0.5-1.5X their individual minimal erythema dose (MED). One part of the experiment will involve applying a topical natural product (caffeine or EGCG) and placebo to bilateral symmetric sites. The natural product and the placebo will be applied immediately after and at 1/2 hour, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, 6 hours, 8 hours, 24 hours, 25 hours, and 27 hours after exposure to a 0.5-1.5 MED dose of UV light. Another part of the study involves performing skin biopsies. One will be done prior to UVB exposure, 2 will be done at 24 hours and 2 more will be done at 48 hours.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Principal Investigator left institution before study could complete.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in UVB-Induced Active Caspase-3-Positive Keratinocytes by Green Tea Compounds
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in number of active caspase-3+ apoptotic keratinocytes between 0- and 48-hour time points was calculated for skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive active test substance (EGCG or caffeine) or placebo (vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in UVB-Induced Apoptotic "Sunburn" Cells by Green Tea Compounds
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in number of apoptotic "sunburn" cells between 0- and 48-hour time points was calculated for skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive active test substance (EGCG or caffeine) or placebo (vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Topical Applications of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Increases in Apoptotic "Sunburn" Cells
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of apoptotic "sunburn" cells was identified in the 48-hr time point skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive 4-6% caffeine in cream vehicle or placebo (cream vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Topical Applications of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Increases in Caspase-3-Positive Cells
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of caspase-3-positive cells was identified in the 48-hr time point skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive 4-6% caffeine in cream vehicle or placebo (cream vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Topical Applications of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Increases in Phospho-p53 (Ser15) Positive Cells
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of phospho-p53 (Ser15) positive cells was identified in the 48-hr time point skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive 4-6% caffeine in cream vehicle or placebo (cream vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Green Tea Compounds on UVB-Induced Erythema
secondary_outcome.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The mean scores at 48 hr were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Erythema
secondary_outcome.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The erythema scores at 6, 8, and 24 hr post-UVB were averaged.

arm_group.description: bilateral comparison of green tea constituent

intervention.description: Green tea product (EGCG or caffeine) in vehicle will be applied immediately after and at sequential time points after exposure of a 5x5-cm area of skin to a dose of UVB that is 0.5-2 times the subject's minimal erythema dose (MED)

Placebo (vehicle alone) will be applied immediately after and at sequential time points after exposure of a 5x5-cm area of skin to a dose of UVB that is 0.5-2 times the subject's minimal erythema dose (MED)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subjects will be normal adult volunteers who are 18 to 65 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who drink more than two cups of coffee, tea, or caffeinated soda/beverages per day.
- Subjects who are unable to get an erythemic response (i.e., a sunburn).

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

group.title: EGCG in Acetone Vehicle (L Side: Active; R Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of EGCG to a test site on the left side of the body and placebo to a test site on the right side of the body.

group.title: EGCG in Acetone Vehicle (R Side: Active; L Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of EGCG to a test site on the right side of the body and placebo to a test site on the left side of the body.

group.title: Caffeine in Acetone Vehicle (L Side: Active; R Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of caffeine to a test site on the left side of the body and placebo to a test site on the right side of the body.

group.title: Caffeine in Acetone Vehicle (R Side: Active; L Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of caffeine to a test site on the right side of the body and placebo to a test site on the left side of the body.

group.title: Caffeine in Cream Vehicle (L Side: Active; R Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of caffeine to a test site on the left side of the body and placebo to a test site on the right side of the body.

group.title: Caffeine in Cream Vehicle (R Side: Active; L Side: Placebo)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects randomized to this group received applications of caffeine to a test site on the right side of the body and placebo to a test site on the left side of the body.

group.title: Bilateral Comparison
group.description: In this bilateral comparison study, subjects were randomized to receive applications of green tea product or placebo to test sites on the left and right sides of the body.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in UVB-Induced Active Caspase-3-Positive Keratinocytes by Green Tea Compounds
outcome.description: The mean change in number of active caspase-3+ apoptotic keratinocytes between 0- and 48-hour time points was calculated for skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive active test substance (EGCG or caffeine) or placebo (vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.
outcome.population: Six (6) subjects were randomized (split-body) to receive either EGCG (3 subjects) or caffeine (3 subjects) in acetone vehicle on a test site on one side of the body and placebo (acetone vehicle) on the test site on the other side of the body, after exposure to twice the individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.

group.title: EGCG in Acetone Vehicle
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of EGCG (28.3 mg/mL; active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo (Acetone Vehicle in Subjects Who Received EGCG)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of acetone vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Caffeine in Acetone Vehicle
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of caffeine (12 mg/mL; active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo (Acetone Vehicle in Subjects Who Received Caffeine)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of acetone vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

outcome.title: Effect of Topical Applications of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Increases in Apoptotic "Sunburn" Cells
outcome.description: The percentage of apoptotic "sunburn" cells was identified in the 48-hr time point skin biopsy samples of subjects who had been exposed to UVB on symmetrical right and left test sites which were then randomized to receive 4-6% caffeine in cream vehicle or placebo (cream vehicle) at sequential time points after UVB exposure.
outcome.population: Twenty (20) subjects received caffeine on one test site and placebo on the other site after exposure to individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.Twenty-six (26) subjects received caffeine on one test site and placebo on the other site after exposure to UVB that was 1.5 times subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Caffeine in Vehicle Cream (1.0 MED Group)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of 6% caffeine (active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB at the subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of cream vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB at the subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

outcome.title: Effect of Green Tea Compounds on UVB-Induced Erythema
outcome.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The mean scores at 48 hr were calculated.
outcome.population: Six (6) subjects were randomized (split-body) to receive either EGCG (3 subjects) or caffeine (3 subjects) in acetone vehicle on a test site on one side of the body and placebo (acetone vehicle) on the test site on the other side of the body, after exposure to twice the individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.

group.title: EGCG in Acetone Vehicle
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of EGCG (28.3 mg/mL; active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo (Acetone Vehicle in Subjects Who Received EGCG)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of acetone vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Caffeine in Acetone Vehicle
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of caffeine (12 mg/mL; active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo (Acetone Vehicle in Subjects Who Received Caffeine)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of acetone vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was twice their individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

measure.title: Effect of Green Tea Compounds on UVB-Induced Erythema
measure.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The mean scores at 48 hr were calculated.
measure.population: Six (6) subjects were randomized (split-body) to receive either EGCG (3 subjects) or caffeine (3 subjects) in acetone vehicle on a test site on one side of the body and placebo (acetone vehicle) on the test site on the other side of the body, after exposure to twice the individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.

outcome.title: Effect of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Erythema
outcome.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The erythema scores at 6, 8, and 24 hr post-UVB were averaged.
outcome.population: Sixty-two (62) subjects received caffeine on one test site and placebo on the other site after exposure to 0.5-1.5 times individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.

group.title: Caffeine in Vehicle Cream (0.5 MED Group)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of 6% caffeine (active drug) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB at 0.5 times the subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo Cream (0.5 MED Group)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of cream vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB at 0.5 times the subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

group.title: Placebo Cream (1.5 MED Group)
group.description: bilateral comparison Subjects were randomized to receive applications of cream vehicle (placebo) on the test site on one side of the body after exposure to UVB that was 1.5 times subjects' individual minimal erythema dose (MED).

measure.title: Effect of 4-6% Caffeine on UVB-Induced Erythema
measure.description: Erythema of the right and left test sites was scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 = no evidence [no erythema]; 1 = mild [pink or light red color]; 2 = moderate [red color]; 3 = severe [very red or dark color]) including half-integer grading. Scoring was performed immediately after UVB exposure and at sequential time points thereafter. The erythema scores at 6, 8, and 24 hr post-UVB were averaged.
measure.population: Sixty-two (62) subjects received caffeine on one test site and placebo on the other site after exposure to 0.5-1.5 times individual subjects' minimal erythema dose (MED) of UVB.

group.title: Bilateral Comparison
group.description: In this bilateral comparison study, subjects were randomized to receive applications of green tea product or placebo to test sites on the left and right sides of the body after exposure of the test sites to UVB.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Early termination leading to small numbers of subjects analyzed
